author: AF
text: I sold the item 15817043 on VC, almost two months ago, but they lost th item on the post and I was not paid yet. This is very abbusive and illegal behavihour. Their contract with the sellers say that they have to disptach the items within 7 days to be able to keep the sale and 5 days to be able to fit into your expert programme. Nevertheless, the whole thing is a lie, because their delivery service does not work and their customer service is like a collection of boots. They do not count the time that the seller takes to dispatch the item to them (their contract with the seller) but rather the deliver time of the carrier. Therefore, if the delivery company is delayed or looses the item, the seller pays the bill. This is a very dangerous company. I have worked with them for 6 years or so, but their service is going down the hill. I beleive that they will shut down soon. Also, their authentication service is a failure like everyone says. It happened to me having the same item certified as authentic and replica several times. Also, previous workers at the company, left the company and emailed me on my private email to offer their services. So, you know how dodgy it is.
title: Very dangerous company

author: Magda
text:
Since they started using Hermes my experience had been absolutely horrible. Every time I sell something in UK with direct shipping there is a problem. 

Before, with UPS or DHL there was no issues whatsoever.

Now I waste time chatting to incompetent customer service, then email them, every time getting different answers.

My item was delivered through the letter box. Buyer has 72 hours to report any issues. Nothing reported but Hermes doesn’t update the tracking on Vestiaire website. 

Five days after delivery, no payment, no update. In the meantime had three chats with them and exchange emails. 

During one of the chats they assured me my payment was on the way.

Then in the email they say they need to confirm parcel pick up!! What????!!!

Customer service don’t know the difference between a parcel shop (where you can collect your parcel from if you choose this option) and a letter box! Seriously??!!

Here’s a reply from them:

“ We would like to inform you that we will email the buyer to confirm if the item was already pick up on the letter box.
 
Once we confirmed we'll process your payment as soon as possible.
 
I'll keep you posted once I heard back.”

So the buyer needs to confirm that they picked up the parcel from their floor??? What is going on here??

Where is the seller in all that?

Utterly ridiculous! Absolute clowns!
title: Incompetent customer service, payment delays. Avoid!

author: Ludmilla Churchill
text:
I wouldnt recommend this platform for sellers. I despatched all my items within 24 hours. I didnt realise that some of my items were shipped to so called ' collection points', in fact those places turned out to be Tabacconists. I was waiting on average 3 weeks until a buyer bothered to collect their parcel. Needless to say, I wasnt paid until the item was collected plus 3 days for feedback. The label didnt indicate the item was going to a 'collection point'. 2.Vestiaire uses return labels for forward shipping. It means as a seller 'you returned unwanted item' and can make no claim against a carrier. Sold items leave your possession with Vestiaire shipping labels but they refuse to take responsibility for shipping mishaps. On one occasion I had to wait for about 6weeks for a payment after the item went astray. I told Vestiaire to pay me and then make a claim as shipping was their responsibility but they took no notice. 3. The vast majority of DHL points dont accept returns, only forward  shipping thus I had to travel 20 miles to one point only that was accepting return labels. 4. I asked to send me a UPS label 2 mins walk from my home, they refused. 5. On one occasion they sold my item during the pandemic. I tried to cancel a sale unable to find a place accepting a DHL return label, web site malfunctioned and after 8 attempts cancellation failed. My item was in my orders and I was virtually harassed by reminders to ship the item. Eventually I travelled 20 miles and posted the item with a live valid label. A week after shipping they told me that they had refunded the buyer because I tried to cancel the sale. Remember that AFTER THEY REFUNDED THE BUYER the item was sitting in my orders, I was relentlessly reminded to ship and the shipping  label was live. Of course I had no idea that they had refunded the buyer. 6. As a seller you will be incessantly pursued to reduce the price. 7. Vestiaire charged me a £100 commission fee on a £380 transaction. I suggested that instead of harassing a seller to reduce the price, they might facilitate a sale by reducing their commission fee.8. Petty nitpicking about my new Prada bag stalled the sale because arguably the dimensions of a large tote were 2-5cm  larger or smaller, not sure. How does it sound to you? And that's not all. I sold 25 items, dont remember one smooth transaction; highest final value fees worst service. And dont remind me of their 'expertise', mind blowing undervaluations and overlooked faults in purchased items.
How on earth Vestiaire gets 3/4 stars????? Do people have a random luck and write about an odd positive experience?
title: Draw your own conclusions

author: Petra Hartmann
text: I purchased a vintage scarf from a UK seller, (being in the UK myself) I was not given the option for a direct purchase and the item needed to be sent to their authentication in France. The cost of this was displayed and added on to my final bill along with shipping fees. The import duty and tax section clearly stated £0 and the final cost clearly stated “total including tax.” I am now being charged £77.60 extra for import tax! Talk about fraudulent and misrepresentation of sales. I will be claiming this back through my credit card company if VC does not refund me for the mis-sale of this item. Very unfair and unprofessional system.
title: Beware of using this company

author: Daniil Shcherbakov
text:
I bought a used expensive bag from the UK to avoid customs fees since I'm also in the UK.

Initially, the checkout page showed no additional taxes expected.

Since the bag was subject to authentification, it was first sent to the authentication facility. I had nothing against that BEFORE I KNEW THAT THIS FREAKING AUTHENTIFICATION HUB IS IN FRANCE?!

Now I should pay a couple of hundreds of pounds for customs fees, in other words, for importing my bag back from the authentification facility in France. BUT THIS BAG WAS INITIALLY IN THE UK.

I wasn't advised that the authentification hub is not in the UK and might be charged additional fees. 

What is even more ridiculous they have such information on their website, but it is hidden deeply in the FAQ, and I found it myself when I saw that the bag was sent to France, but not when I was placing the order.

I contacted the customer help, but they were useless and rude. They told me they couldn't cancel the order and shipping (I reached out to them 2 hours after the bag was shipped), so the only way I could get the bag now is to pay the fees.

I demand you, Vestiare Collective, to cover the customs fees yourself.

Anyway, I will never order on your site again and advise everyone to beware of your scam-like service. 

Finally, please, don't forget one of the general rules of marketing - satisfied client brings two new clients. Unsatisfied client takes four new prospects away.
title: Horrible site. SCAM!

author: Claus
text:
Let me start by saying that if everything goes well, then it’s an okay experience, but really VC can’t take any credit for it because the site itself is clumsy and cumbersome and also it’s all down to another honest seller putting in the work, not them.

If something indeed goes wrong, then you’re stuck with the most incompetent customer service ever who seem to either not speak proper English (maybe due to the fact that they’re offshore in the Philippines, gone are they days when you had Europe-based staff that would speak your local language) or hold you for an imbecile.
Shoes 18420539 came with slightly damaged soles and VC accepts that it’s a defect which wasn’t clear from the listing.
Now I’d like to keep them and am asking for a partial reduction (of only 15 Euros, something perfectly reasonable in my eyes), but the customer service agent has now for the 5th time confirmed there is no way of issuing this. By now that has probably cost them more than what I’m asking so it’s not even frustrating a customer, but also simply idiotic from a business perspective. Not sure why you’d make a customer go through all this when they’ve already gathered a decent lifetime spend rather than making them consider eBay, RealReal, Rebag and all these other competitors out there due to your incompetent customer service. You could even write it off as retention marketing spend.
Worst thing is that the communication with the CS rep is more frustrating knowing that there is probably an actual person on the other side who chooses to ignore everything you say and copy-pastes the same thing for five times in a row. It would be easier to accept this from a bot, at least they don’t have the option to think for themselves.
I’m reaching out here to be able to speak to someone who has their senses together.
title: Absolutely frustrating customer service experience

author: Danielle
text:
Ref items:

15393798
16490893
16215034

I sent out 7 pairs of UGG boots via direct shipping on 3rd October. 3 of the items (referenced above) were not collected by the customer and the tracking information stated on 14th October that the items were being returned to me.

I’ve since been going round in circles on the online chat and eventually asked for a direct email address to avoid explaining myself yet again - this email does not work and there is no telephone number to speak to an actual person. You have to fill in the enquiry form and hope and pray someone replies to you.

After getting a response and going back and forth with one of their customer service team - I’m left with no choice but to leave a bad review. It’s been 4 weeks since I sent out my items and I have neither my boots or the payment. 

I am repeatedly informed by a copy and paste email of the information provided by Hermes on 14th October - that my items are being returned to me when they are clearly lost and the tracking has not been updated.

I am unable to contact Hermes myself as I no longer have the postcodes for the deliveries - I used Vestiaire’s pre paid shipping labels as they arranged the delivery - I cannot contact Hermes without the postcodes. I have informed customer service of this but they have stopped replying to me.

Prior to this everything was ok with selling on Vestiaire - but once there is a problem - say goodbye to your items and money. Shambolic customer service, it’s a disgrace and such a shame. As a previous reviewer said - it’s daylight robbery. 

It seems it’s a common problem with Hermes not updating the tracking on Vestiaires website and no one at Vestiaire is willing to follow up or open a case with the courier. It also seems odd that 3 items are missing - I did enquire as to whether the items had been sent back to Vestiaire instead of me - but again - no response from customer service.

I don’t enjoy leaving a bad review but it’s more the principle after losing my items, not getting paid and dealing with an incompetent company that refuse to help - if they were based in the UK I would be contacting trading standards and taking it further but sadly there’s nothing I can do other than warn others not to sell with them. I’m only glad that it wasn’t 3 extremely high value items that I sold.

—————————————————-
Edit - it’s now 14th November and I STILL have neither my boots or my money - I will contact Vestiaire today and see if I get a response.

—————————————————-
Edit - Credit where credit is due - I finally received the payment for my items today on 17th November which I am very grateful for. It’s just a shame the whole process has been so painful.
title: When Something Goes Wrong..
